H0.text: what type of government was formed when italy unified. Constitutional Monarchy

H1.text: what type of government was formed when italy unified. Federal Republic

H2.text: what type of government was formed when italy unified. Absolute Monarchy

H3.text: what type of government was formed when italy unified. Parliamentary republic

A4.text: The Kingdom of Italy was a constitutional monarchy. Executive power belonged to the monarch, who governed through appointed ministers.

A5.text: The legislative branch was a bicameral Parliament comprising an appointive Senate and an elective Chamber of Deputies.
